guidelines.title: Medicine Safety Guidelines
guidelines.point1: These medicines are for mild symptoms and short-term use only
guidelines.point2: Always read the medicine information carefully before use
guidelines.point3: Do not exceed the recommended dosage or duration
guidelines.point4: Consult a healthcare professional if symptoms persist or worsen

notice.title: Important Medical Notice
notice.description: The medicines shown here are available in our vending machine for common mild symptoms. This system is not a substitute for professional medical advice. For serious conditions, allergic reactions, or if symptoms persist, please seek immediate medical attention.

generalGuidelines.title: General Usage Guidelines
generalGuidelines.point1: Take as directed on the package or as advised by a healthcare professional
generalGuidelines.point2: Do not exceed the recommended dosage
generalGuidelines.point3: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight

detail.1: Take on an empty stomach approximately 1–2 hours before or after meals.
detail.2: Can be taken 2 hours before or after other medications.
detail.3: Can be mixed with water in an appropriate ratio for children to take.
detail.4: Drink water after taking the medication.
detail.5: Do not take this medicine at the same time as other medications.
detail.6: May cause black stools, which is harmless as the black color is from the medicine.
detail.7: May cause bloating, flatulence, or abdominal discomfort in some individuals, which is a normal effect of the medicine absorbing toxins in the body.
detail.8: If diarrhea does not improve within 2-3 days after taking the medicine, consult a doctor.
detail.9: Pregnant or breastfeeding women, those recovering from surgery, or individuals with gastrointestinal diseases should consult a doctor or pharmacist before use.
detail.10: Avoid consuming dairy products, syrups, alcohol, or fermented foods after taking the medicine.
detail.11: Not suitable for individuals exposed to severe toxic substances such as strong acids or alkalis, as it may be difficult to neutralize the toxins.
detail.14: In severe cases, overuse may result in intestinal blockage.
detail.15: Paracetamol can be taken before or after meals.
detail.16: Dosage should be appropriate to body weight.
detail.17: Take at least 4-6 hours apart, and do not exceed 8 tablets (4,000 mg) per day in the 500 mg form.
detail.18: Drink water after taking the medication.
detail.19: If you forget a dose, take it as soon as you remember without doubling the dose for the next intake.
detail.20: If the fever does not subside within 3 days of use, consult a doctor for further diagnosis.
detail.21: Do not take the medication continuously for more than 5 days. If symptoms persist, consult a doctor for further diagnosis.
detail.22: Avoid using this medication with other products containing paracetamol, as it may lead to overdose.
detail.23: If an allergic reaction occurs, such as rash, itching, swelling of the face, eyelids, or lips, hives, dizziness, or difficulty breathing, seek immediate medical attention.
detail.24: Individuals who regularly consume alcohol or have liver and kidney diseases should consult a doctor or pharmacist before use.
detail.25: Do not take the medication if you do not have the listed symptoms.
detail.26: Overdose (more than 150 mg/kg of body weight) may cause nausea.
detail.28: Overdose may cause drowsiness and low blood pressure.
detail.29: Overdose may impair liver and kidney function.

medicineDescription.1: Activated Charcoal 260 mg is used to treat diarrhea, bloating, and to absorb toxins in the digestive system.
medicineDescription.2: Paracetamol 500 mg is used to reduce fever and relieve general pain such as headaches. Suitable for adults and children aged 12 years and above.
medicineDescription.3: Orphenadrine 35 mg and Paracetamol 450 mg are used to relieve muscle pain in areas such as the neck, legs, and back caused by muscle tension or spasms.
medicineDescription.4: Mefenamic Acid 500 mg is used to relieve menstrual pain and other moderate pain such as toothache.
medicineDescription.5: A basic small wound cleaning kit includes iodine, alcohol, and adhesive bandages.
